articles.title: Don't let alarmists scare you about heat deaths
articles.summary: Bjorn Lomborg is critical of the media's focus on extreme heat waves and heat deaths. articles.title: Astronomer reveals the three shortest days of this year

Earth rotates in 23 hours, 56 minutes, 4 seconds and 90.5 milliseconds. The kind of day most people go by is 24 hours long. The extra 4 minutes come from the fact that Earth has to rotate 1 more degree, to 361 degrees, for the Sun to appear in the same place again. Wind in Earth's atmosphere is the biggest influence on the length of each day.
